title: Grand Chinese New Year celebration held in London
description: A congratulatory letter from UK Prime Minister Rishi Sunak was read out at the event. title: I tested hypnotherapy to kick my disgusting vaping habit after demolishing one Elf Bar disposable per day – did it work?
description: Just last month, Rishi Sunak announced new plans to ban disposable vapes after alarming research showed they can be seriously damaging to children’s health. Five million of the e-cigs are thrown away each week in the UK, leading to an environmental disaster.

title: Nottingham attacks: Second police force investigated over contact with killer
description: The police watchdog has started an investigation into a force's contact with Valdo Calocane before he killed three people in Nottingham. The Independent Office for Police Conduct (IOPC) review follows a voluntary referral by Nottinghamshire Police of complaints it has received from the victims' families.

title: Two suspected migrants found in luggage compartment of school coach after France trip
description: Parents have told of their shock after two suspected migrants were discovered in the luggage compartment of a school coach as it returned to Hampshire from France. Officers were called to Hounsdown School in Totton on Saturday evening following reports that two young men were found lying inside the hold of the vehicle.

description: The latest Redfield & Wilton Strategies survey showed the Conservatives on just 21 per cent support among voters, which is down three points since last week.

title: GALLERY: Prime Minister Rishi Sunak visits Harrogate
description: Mr Sunak, on his first engagement of the week, visited the Harrogate Bus Company ‘s depot in Starbeck to show support for Conservative MP Andrew Jones, who will attempt to win the Harrogate and Knaresborough seat for a fifth time at the next general election.

title: Labour Withdraws Support for Candidate in Antisemitism Scandal

title: Tories ‘could lose more than half of England’s 100 most rural seats’
description: The Conservatives could lose more than half of the 100 most rural seats in England at the election, according to a poll that has dealt another blow to Rishi Sunak. The Survation survey showed that Labour holds a lead in the polls in the seats, which have traditionally formed Conservative heartlands.

title: Rishi Sunak avoids saying when he last caught a bus in Yorkshire
description: Rishi Sunak was unable to recall when he last caught a bus as he talked about how services in the north are benefitting from HS2 being scrapped. The prime minister dodged the question from BBC Look North while visiting a bus depot in Harrogate on Monday.

title: Why Rishi Sunak is still facing a nightmare week despite Parliament in recess, as inflation figures, by-elections and Rwanda debate looms
description: Labour’s shock wins in Tamworth and Mid Bedfordshire last year meant the Tories had not seen such poor by-election results since the run-up to Tony Blair’s 1997 general election landslide. Losing these seats would rattle the many Conservative MPs already worried about their own constituencies.

title: India trying to push watered-down trade deal: UK
description: The trade deal talks between India and the UK have run into a deadlock with both sides hardening their stands amid elections scheduled in both the countries.

title: 'Rishi Sunak has to call an election in 6 weeks - he has no other choice'
